programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: The Burj Dubai holds the title as the tallest man-made structure ever built, pushing the technological envelope. Near India's capital Delhi, the Qutub Minar reigns supreme for almost a thousand years as the world's tallest brick minaret.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers
programme.desc: On an island the size of Singapore, water scarcity is a dire issue. The solution is the construction of an urban reservoir, the first of its kind in the world. Together with cutting-edge technology, Singapore is on its way to water sufficiency.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 3
programme.desc: Tankers are the workhorses of our modern economy and the largest of these are built in Korea. Features like double-hulls and multiple tanks have pushed the cargo and safety capacity of tankers to new heights, making them the mainstay of the oil industry.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 4
programme.desc: For years, the roads of Mumbai were a hotbed of congestion and overcrowding. Now, a dynamic link road promises to ease the city's traffic woes, but the construction of Mumbai's first double-tiered flyover has been anything but easy.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 5
programme.desc: The largest airport terminal in the world in Beijing is an engineering marvel that nonetheless pays strict adherence to the principles of Chinese Feng shui, and marks a new footnote in an age-old tradition of building big.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 6
programme.desc: It is the world's deepest immersed Tunnel, the Marmaray Project promises to ease Istanbul's decades-old traffic woes. Located in an earthquake zone, it is an engineering feat that is only rivaled by the discovery of a nearby ancient port.

programme.title: Engineering Ground Breakers: Episode 8
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam is the largest hydroelectric dam in the world. That it is a sheer engineering marvel cannot be denied. Yet questions abound over environmental and social issues, not to mention logistics problems of moving ships up and downriver.

programme.desc: Want crispy, no-fuss French fries? We test top air fryers and tell you which model works best. Kick back with the ultimate grilled cheese and enjoy old-fashioned frozen custard, no churning required.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein enjoys a winter break in Reykjavik in search of the perfect cod and sampling succulent fjord-reared roast lamb.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick enjoys a weekend in Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell enticingly side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall teems today with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire. It is home to comfort dishes like tafelspitz and goulash, and it also gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes, the wiener schnitzel.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits Bologna in northern Italy, a city so famous for its food that it's known as the stomach of Italy. He learns how to make the local fresh egg pasta used for tortellini, tagliatelle, ravioli and lasagne.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the home of New Nordic cuisine, Copenhagen, where ground-breaking chefs create artful dishes and religiously stick to seasonal Danish ingredients. Rick goes foraging for rosehip and learns about the art of pickling buds, bark and flowers.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein heads to southern Spain and the historic city of Cadiz, where the narrow winding streets captivate him as he walks in the footsteps of the ancient Phoenician and Arab traders whose influence on the city can still be seen today.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein's long weekends across Europe come to a conclusion in the city of Palermo.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc creates four mouth-watering chocolate recipes: a simple mousse, rich chocolate delice, fondant with a melting middle, and his signature dessert: cafe creme, which is a chocolate-sculpted cup filled with a mousse and coffee sabayon.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Raymond dives into the world of fish with the underused and affordable mackerel; he creates a light meal of grilled mackerel with a soy lime dressing.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc looks to the UK's favorite fruit, apples, for inspiration; he returns to memories of childhood with a simple tart made with a foolproof pastry and custard filling.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc celebrates the season with a winter vegetable salad featuring beetroots, a celeriac puree served with a crisp-skinned roast wild duck with blackberry sauce and watercress soup.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc uses two seasonal ingredients, game and mushrooms, to create a French version of a pasty called pithivier, which is filled with a rich mix of pheasant, chestnuts and dried fruits; he also makes a cep mushroom tortellini with fresh pasta.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: The miracle of yeast helps Raymond to create a French classic: brioche; he gets down to basics with a French country bread recipe that's essential for any baker to add to their repertoire; lastly, he makes a spectacular apple croustade.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc combines the universally popular ingredients of egg and cheese to make a classic omelette with a secret technique; he then uses a Comte from his home region in France to make a family-style souffle.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc focuses on tomatoes, opening with a simple salad recipe inspired by his mother; he also makes a creamy risotto, stuffed tomatoes glazed with cheese and a series of ices and sorbets to cleanse the palate with elegance.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella introduces her love of Italian food through a spectacular yet simple Sicilian pasta with tomatoes, garlic and almonds, and a mid-week family feast of tagliata.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson shares the secrets of her Italian roast chicken, served alongside a saffron orzotto; Nigella prepares coffee ice cream for dessert, inspired by the ice cream parlors of Florence; a chocolate olive oil cake provides an extra treat.

programme.desc: An emotional Julz says farewell to the dog packs; he discovers the Stork colony pups hunting guinea fowl, and is heartened to find the Kakuli pups feeding on an antelope carcass; the playful Manzi pack corner a tough warthog.

programme.title: Bears of the Karawank Mountains

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School

programme.title: Deep in the Heart

programme.title: Big Cats

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.desc: The most elemental and pure survival is based on eating; if an animal is not healthy, strong, and agile, they cannot compete to mate, defend their family from any threat, nor will they be able to achieve good status in their clan.

programme.title: Wildlife ER

programme.desc: The most battle-hardened combat robots in the UK compete in the MechMania Grand Final. After three heats, the tournament switches to a one-on-one sudden-death format until one team emerges as the victor.

programme.title: Robot Wars World Series
programme.desc: Former champions Apollo, Sabretooth, Terrorhurtz and Gabriel 2 take on a true legend, the highly flammable Diotoir. Making up the Rest of the World team are TMWHK from the Netherlands, Cobra from Belgium and Rabid M8 from Portugal.

programme.title: Robot Wars World Series
programme.desc: Reigning champions Eruption lead a team of some of the fiercest robots in the UK, Big Nipper, Concussion and Thor all fighting for international glory. Their opposition are captained by silicon valley millionaire Michael Mauldin and robot Cathadh.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Follow Team Chaos's journey, from humble beginnings to how they ended up building one of the most feared Robots ever to compete.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is throwing a very special BBQ called Asado; plus Martha prepares a chimichurri sauce, her daughter Alexis's chopped salad and for dessert, fruit flavored popsicles; a perfect celebration.
programme.sub-title: Martha Throws an Argentine Asado BBQ

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: One of Martha's favorite things to do is to make jam with the perfectly ripened fruit and berries grown on her Bedford farm; Martha shares her favorite recipes, as well as jam and jarring techniques.
programme.sub-title: The Perfect Jams to Pair With a Simple Breakfast

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Meet Martha in one of her favorite places on the farm - the chicken coop to talk about one of her favorite things to eat - eggs; Martha will share her top methods for making an egg-cellent breakfast.
programme.sub-title: How to Properly Cook an Egg

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Tonight is pasta night in Bedford; Martha and friends make three pasta dishes, including a recipe from her new restaurant, The Bedford, a no-knife spaghetti, and a lemon angel hair pasta.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha takes shellfish to the next level with sustainable oysters, baked stuffed clams and more.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: From a pan seared steak with bordelaise sauce to a classic sizzling steak fired up on the grill, Martha makes steak dinners cooked to perfection with the help of her Head of Culinary at the farm.

programme.desc: Lemon/cherry trifle; water-repellent picnic blanket; quick-cooking striped bass.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living

programme.sub-title: Maine (Field Trip): Lobster Roll; Individual Blueberry Pies

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden; this year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock; learn the how-tos of building a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shows how to properly move an established tree on her very own Christmas tree farm; she gives a tour of her pinetum where she teaches about new and unusual conifer trees.
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha creates an incredible Vietnamese feast with her friend Monica Tran, including lettuce-wrapped golden fried spring rolls, traditional pho soup, and savory sizzling pancakes.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha makes homemade apple cider, a tender pork roast with apples and braised red cabbage; and of course, we can't have an apple show without dessert.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha serves up a delicious chicken dinner with fresh ingredients from her greenhouse; joined by her good friend Kevin Sharkey, they celebrate the perfect meal for a taste of home-cooked goodness.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: The man behind Beal's Lobster Pier, where Martha's loves to dine in Maine, shows viewers everything they need to know about boiling lobster; then, Martha turns up the flavor with her spicy lobster linguine.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha serves up delicious homemade pizzas alongside friends and pizza chefs Christian Petroni and Dean Medico; featuring classic pizzas, signature sauces, and more.
programme.sub-title: Pizza Perfection: Sicilian and Neapolitan-Style Pizzas

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits the Japanese restaurant Joji in the heart of New York, where Chef George Ruan shares his secrets for the ultimate omakase experience; culinary giant Daniel Boulud stops by.
programme.sub-title: Japanese Cuisine: Sushi, Sashimi and More

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha starts off brunch with a citrus cocktail Mary's knees; Chef Ignacio Mattos joins and makes an omelette with caviar and creme fraiche; Martha makes an endive salad; Martha makes waffles.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Making fresh pasta by hand and with a machine; shaping dough into farfalle and tortelli.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Traditional pasta sauce; slow-cooked Bolognese; puttanesca; carbonara; a light sauce made with bottarga.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Seafood chef Dave Pasternack explains buying, butchering and storing fish; boning a round or flat fish; cleaning a squid; crudo.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Dredging meat or fish in flour, then cooking over high heat to ensure a golden-brown finish; wiener schnitzel; chicken piccata; sole a la meuniere; pan sauces.

programme.desc: Spaghetti pie; kicked-up stuffed garlic bread; skewers with creamy dressing; Emeril's kicked-up brownie ice cream sandwiches.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Swedish pancakes; toasted ravioli; bbq pork; pulled pork sandwiches with slaw and fried pickles; café brûlot.

programme.title: Emeril Live
programme.desc: Hurricane punch; big crowd roasted garlic chicken with angel hair pasta; roasted vegetable salad with goat cheese; cranberry-apple crisp.

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Grilled rack of lamb with a mixed herb pesto and a side of grilled potatoes with feta.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: A salt crusted branzino seasoned with citrus; grilled calamari and seafood paella.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Sweet and savory apple recipes.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Honey soaked and butter drenched baklava and a delightful appetizer, tuna tarter in phyllo cups.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shows how easy it is to make fresh pasta at home.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: One of a kind wild mushroom ragout creamy stone ground grits.

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Emeril meets David Blossman, the head of Louisiana's favorite brewery, Abita Brewing Company, and creates a menu inspired by his bayou brews.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Emeril gets inspired by New Orleans' annual Voodoo Fest and creates a meal of black-eyed pea jambalaya, ham hock and cabbage soup, and sweet rum balls.

programme.title: In This Corner Of The World [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A spirited 18-year-old woman is married off to a man she barely knows and must soon adjust to the struggles of living in Hiroshima during World War II.

programme.title: Millennium Actress [Japanese-Language Version]
programme.desc: When the legendary Ginei Studios shuts down, filmmaker Genya Tachibana and his assistant are tasked with interviewing its reclusive star, Chiyoko Fujiwara, who had retired from the spotlight 30 years prior.

programme.title: DEEMO Memorial Keys
programme.desc: Deemo lives in a castle all by herself and one day, a little girl falls from the sky. Alice doesn't remember anything about her past and Deemo tries to help her. A tree begins to grow whenever the piano plays, weaving a mystery.

programme.title: City Hunter: Death of the Vicious Criminal Ryo Saeba
programme.desc: City Hunter, Ryo Saeba, after months of idleness, finally scores a client and it is none other than the beautiful Mega City TV newscaster, Sayaka, who fears for her life.

programme.title: City Hunter: Shinjuku Private Eyes
programme.desc: In this 2019 reboot of the iconic City Hunter saga, private detective Ryo Saeba is hired to be model Ai Shindo's bodyguard after she was viciously attacked.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden: The Movie
programme.desc: A long time ago, a powerful spirit drove the world to the brink of destruction. Naruto's latest mission is to protect Shion, a priestess from the Land of Ogres, whom the spirit is after.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Bonds
programme.desc: Mysterious flying ninja have launched a sudden attack against the Leaf. To save their village, Naruto and his friends set out to stop this new threat.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Will of Fire
programme.desc: Four Kekkei Genkai shinobi who have been guarding the Cloud, Stone, Mist and Sand disappear without a trace. At the same time, Naruto discovers that Kakashi has left the village.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: The Lost Tower
programme.desc: The Rogue Ninja Mukade is about to be caught by Naruto, when he summons the power of an ancient underground channel of chakra. Naruto gets caught up in the chakra and is sent back in time.

programme.title: Bottle Shock
programme.desc: The story of the early days of California wine making featuring the now infamous, blind Paris wine tasting of 1976 that has come to be known as "Judgment of Paris". Feat: Chris Pine, Alan Rickman & Bill Pullman.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: Legendary
programme.desc: Cal Chetley is a bright, engaging, undersized fifteen year-old who's been picked on most of his life. Cal joins his high school wrestling team in the hopes his brother will train him. More importantly, Cal uses wrestling as the tool to reunite his family.

programme.title: The Final Cut
programme.desc: Robin Williams, Mira Sorvino, and Jim Caviezel give dynamic performances in this mind-blowing thriller about the dark side of futuristic technology.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: War
programme.desc: A full-throttle, martial arts thriller, WAR stars Jet Li and Jason Statham as two adversaries set on a violent collision course in the Asian mob underground.

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: A rare book dealer, while seeking out the last two copies of a demon text, gets drawn into a conspiracy with supernatural overtones. Starring: Johnny Depp, Frank Langella, Lena Olin

programme.title: Cold Souls: Cold Souls
programme.desc: Paul is an actor who feels bogged down by his participation in a production of Chekov's play, Vanya.

programme.title: My Dog The Space Traveller
programme.desc: When a boy loses his dog in his backyard he finds it’s gone through a portal which leads to another dimension of our universe. He must rely on his friends and family to get his dog back before the portal closes.

programme.title: Mumbo Jumbo
programme.desc: Thomas Doubting stumbles upon a magical amulet which takes him on a mysterious journey to the island of Sinmouth. The locals believe he is 'Mumbo Jumbo' – an entity who will restore their fortunes and rescue the beautiful Princess Vanilla.

programme.title: Cadia: The World Within
programme.desc: Devastated by the loss of their mother, three teens discover a mystical realm ruled by unseen forces and must overcome evil in the order to return home.

programme.title: Wish Upon a Star: Wish Upon a Star
programme.desc: In this cult classic, younger sister Hayley Wheaton (Danielle Harris) wishes to switch places with her popular older sister Alexia (Katherine Heigl) and the two bickering siblings awaken to find the wish has come true.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: The Amazing Fox
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Amanda desperately wants a dog but her Dad won't let her. When she finds a young fox, she and her friend Maggie conspire to keep it as a pet. Can Amanda and Maggie outfox the adults?

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and to restore order to his world.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows - Original Movie
programme.desc: Toad, Rat, Mole and Badger follow animal etiquette in this version of Kenneth Grahame's classic, in stop-motion model animation.

programme.title: To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time itself for the love of his princess and the future of his land.

programme.title: Scales
programme.desc: Mermaids are real! Siren has lived her whole life thinking she's an ordinary girl, but on the eve of her 12th birthday she learns that she is destined to become a mermaid. She must say goodbye to her entire life as she transitions into the water.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sharks and Recreation
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the pressure begins to take a toll on the captains.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Mighty Bite
programme.desc: With only two weeks left in the fishing season and the price of blue fin tuna on the rise, the Gloucester captains race to bring in record hauls.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Reckoning
programme.desc: There is only one week of fishing left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and the Gloucester fleet is set for a final showdown in a bid to catch the last monster tuna of the year.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Head To Tail (Special)
programme.desc: It's a look back at the best moments from two seasons of Wicked Tuna, featuring the wildest catches and fiercest rivalries, plus a sneak peek at the upcoming third season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Wicked Return
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out for Jeffrey's Ledge in hopes of catching the first fish of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Checkmate
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Blue Fin Tuna Season and the Gloucester captains and their crews, from rookies to old pros, get put to the test.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Into The Storm
programme.desc: Bad weather threatens to end the fishing week for the Gloucester fishermen, but while some boats head for home, others decide to take on Mother Nature's wrath.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Operation T.U.N.A
programme.desc: As the hunt for blue fin tuna intensifies, the fisherman resort to espionage for information.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mission: Fishin!
programme.desc: As Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fleet charges into the heart of the fishing season, it's a tight race for the coveted title of top-earning boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Latitude
programme.desc: It's almost halfway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and the Gloucester fleet has hit a lull in fishing.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle Royale
programme.desc: With the second half of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna fishing season now underway, competition amongst the Gloucester fleet intensifies when tuna become scarce.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Brotherly Shove
programme.desc: A new week calls for new techniques as the Gloucester Captains try unconventional methods to hook their next paycheck.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Blue Grit
programme.desc: Time is running out in the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and, this week, every boat in the Gloucester fleet is facing a different challenge.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Beta Kappa
programme.desc: The tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, know that they have to rely on each other to get the job done, but sometimes trusting the competition isn't such a good idea.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: When corrupt Roman leader Tiberius arrives with a giant army to claim the Silk Road, Huo An teams up his army with an elite Legion of defected Roman soldiers led by General Lucius to protect his country and his new friends.

programme.title: Drive Hard
programme.desc: A former race car driver is abducted by a mysterious thief (John Cusack) and forced to be the wheel-man for a crime that puts them both in the sights of the cops and the mob.

programme.title: Reclaim
programme.desc: A desperate American couple discovers all is not what it seems when they uncover a high-stakes underground scam while traveling abroad. To expose the truth and get back to the U.S., they must risk their lives to save their daughter.

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: When corrupt Roman leader Tiberius arrives with a giant army to claim the Silk Road, Huo An teams up his army with an elite Legion of defected Roman soldiers led by General Lucius to protect his country and his new friends.

programme.title: Drive Hard

programme.title: Reclaim
programme.desc: A desperate American couple discovers all is not what it seems when they uncover a high-stakes underground scam while traveling abroad. To expose the truth and get back to the U.S., they must risk their lives to save their daughter.

programme.title: The Bag Man
programme.desc: A criminal bides his time at a seedy motel, waiting for his boss after killing several men and making away with a mystery bag.

programme.title: Arsenal
programme.desc: A construction-company owner (Adrian Grenier) must rescue his brother, a petty crook, after he is abducted by a vicious mobster (Nicolas Cage). He is aided in his quest by a police detective and longtime friend (John Cusack).

programme.title: The Bag Man
programme.desc: A criminal bides his time at a seedy motel, waiting for his boss after killing several men and making away with a mystery bag.

programme.title: Together Together
programme.desc: When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.

programme.title: Jenny's Wedding
programme.desc: When Jenny decides to marry a woman, her conventional family is forced to accept who she is or risk losing their daughter and their self respect.

programme.title: Boys On The Side
programme.desc: After accidentally committing a crime, three women embark on a cross-country journey that helps them develop something they've never known before.

programme.title: Together Together
programme.desc: When a young loner becomes the gestational surrogate for a single man in his 40s, the two strangers come to realize this unexpected relationship will challenge their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.

programme.title: Jenny's Wedding
programme.desc: When Jenny decides to marry a woman, her conventional family is forced to accept who she is or risk losing their daughter and their self respect.

programme.title: Boys On The Side
programme.desc: After accidentally committing a crime, three women embark on a cross-country journey that helps them develop something they've never known before.

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: In this touching dramedy, a misanthropic poet (Lily Tomlin) takes her granddaughter (Julia Garner) across LA in search of the money she needs to terminate her unwanted pregnancy.

programme.title: DINNER WITH FRIENDS
programme.desc: Molly (Malin Akerman) and Abby (Kat Dennings), along with their crew of close friends and acquaintances, host a dysfunctional, comical and chaotic dinner.

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: In this touching dramedy, a misanthropic poet (Lily Tomlin) takes her granddaughter (Julia Garner) across LA in search of the money she needs to terminate her unwanted pregnancy.

programme.title: Wedding Every Weekend
programme.desc: Nate and Brooke are going to the same four weddings, four weekends in a row. To avoid set-ups, they go together as 'wedding buddies'. But what starts as a friendship soon becomes deeper.

programme.title: Country at Heart
programme.desc: A struggling country singer meets a Nashville songwriter in need of inspiration. Teaming up to write a song, their work gets complicated but results in both a hit song...and true love.

programme.title: All of My Heart
programme.desc: A young caterer’s life suddenly changes course when she inherits a country home and learns she must share it with a career-obsessed Wall Street trader. At first, these opposites do not attract...

programme.title: Campfire Kiss
programme.desc: Feeling disconnected with her teenage son, a protective mother decides to step outside of her comfort zone and take him camping. But as soon as she arrives, she begins butting heads with her handsome cabin neighbor.

programme.title: June In January
programme.desc: Wealthy Alex and blue-collar June are madly in love but get their wires crossed while racing down the aisle. June's been preparing for a very specific kind of wedding her whole life.

programme.title: A Ring By Spring
programme.desc: Business consultant Caryn Briggs is still single at 30, but is in no rush to wed till she playfully agrees to have her fortune read at a charity booth run by soothsayer Madame Rue.

programme.title: The Love Club: Sydney
programme.desc: Former star track athlete, Sydney is now a successful food blogger who still holds a flame for her college boyfriend whom she hasn’t seen in ten years… until now.

programme.title: Hearts In the Game
programme.desc: A NYC publicist helps an MLB pitcher find his way back to the game and to her heart.

programme.title: Love in Glacier National: A National Park Romance
programme.desc: An avalanche forecasting expert brings her new technology to Glacier National Park where she faces push-back from the Director of Mountain Rescue who's trained in intuition and common sense.

programme.title: All of My Heart: Inn Love
programme.desc: Brian and Jenny are engaged and preparing for the grand opening of their bed and breakfast. But when a big storm hits Bucks County, all their plans end up sopping wet.

programme.title: A Christmas Treasure
programme.desc: After opening a 100-year-old time capsule and meeting a charming chef, Lou questions whether or not she should move to New York after Christmas and further her writing career.

programme.title: Must Love Christmas
programme.desc: Known for her Christmas-themed stories, a renowned romance novelist finds herself snowbound in the charming town of Cranberry Falls. She soon finds herself in an unexpected love triangle with her childhood crush and a determined reporter.

programme.title: Small Town Christmas
programme.desc: A high-flying female novelist from New York takes a trip to the small town that inspired her latest best-seller.

programme.title: Sense, Sensibility and Snowmen
programme.desc: Ella and her sister Marianne are HUGE Christmas enthusiasts and own a party planning business. One of their new clients is a toy company and they don't see eye-to-eye with Edward, the company's CEO.

programme.title: The Tree That Saved Christmas
programme.desc: Molly Logan needs a miracle to save her parents' Christmas tree farm from foreclosure. The answer may lie in the sapling Molly rescued as a child.

programme.title: Lights, Camera, Christmas!
programme.desc: When a holiday rom-com movie shooting in her town needs a costume designer, Kerry, a local shop owner, steps into the role. While working on the movie, she rediscovers her passion for costume design.

programme.title: Holiday Hearts
programme.desc: While planning an annual Christmas party, Peyton is forced together with Ben to care for a friend's daughter. While finding their Christmas spirit, will there be some romance along the way?

programme.title: When I Think of Christmas
programme.desc: Sara comes home for Christmas to help her mom move, reconnects with a past love, and makes a surprising discovery for a holiday they will all remember.

programme.title: Long Lost Christmas
programme.desc: Interior designer Hayley plans to surprise her recently widowed mother Patricia with the perfect holiday present: the extended family she knows her mom yearns for.

programme.title: Christmas Festival of Ice
programme.desc: When Emma finds out that her beloved ice-sculpting contest, part of her hometown's Christmas festival, has been canceled, she springs into action.

programme.title: Monty Python Live (Mostly): One Down, Five To Go
programme.desc: Filmed on the final night of the run of ten sold out performances, live at London's O2 Arena, Monty Python Live (mostly) – One Down Five to Go sees the five surviving members together performing many of their classic sketches and much-loved songs.

programme.title: Monty Python: Almost The Truth
programme.desc: The Python Gang reflects on their next misinterpreted and controversially banned film, The Life of Brian.
programme.sub-title: Finally! The Last Episode Ever (For Now...)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: Ministry of Silly Walks (Chevy Chase), Anne Elk (Phill Jupitus), The Dead Parrot (Matt Lucas), The Architects Sketch (Steve Coogan) and Spam (Lee Mack)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: Working Class Playright (Dara O Briain), Self Defence Against Fresh Fruit (Simon Pegg), Nudge Nudge (Charlie Higson), Communist Quiz (Paul Whitehouse), How Not To Be Seen (Seth Green)

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Oscar Wilde, James Abbott McNeill Whistler, George Bernard Shaw and the future Edward VII exchange epigrams at an evening party; mechanical brain surgery fails to dramatically affect a woman's mentality.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Ace of Cakes star chef, Duff Goldman, stops by set with a scorpion cake and we see some of his Unnecessary Costumes. He and Rob also show videos of Grand Entrances and Ghost Holes.

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.desc: Rob dedicates Whisky Throttle and Bear Trap videos to Nitro Circus stunt man, Streetbike Tommy. Tommy also tells us why you should always Bring Your Own Chair.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Lil Jon and Rob enjoy the "Yeah" category inspired by the rapper, watch videos of Dancing Animals, unintentional Body Shots, and people getting Fenced.

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Actress and musical artist, Kat Graham, shows us some of her big moments of One-Liners and how to dance on stage with one shoe. Rob also shows videos of her Magical Spells.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Drift racing super-star, Vaughn Gittin, Jr., reunites with Rob to watch videos featuring Faulty Equipment and High-Speed Chaos. Rob introduces instant classic categories such as Flailers and Stunt Dummies.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob shows the audience how to Escape Your Pain while friend and pro championship skater, Chris Cole, learns what it's like to be in the Hot Seat.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob shows video clips to Jackass veterans Wee Man and Preston of imitators trying to re-create Human Bowling and Wackass pranks.

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness: DJ Pauly D of MTV's Jersey Shore stops by the studio to help weed out some "Jersey Shore Rejects" and show us what a little "Guy Touching and Laughing" is all about!

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculous: Rob, Sterling, and Chanel pick up a few "M.I.L.S," visit some "Early Graves" and enjoy some good old fashion "Russian Good Times."

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, entertainment icon Snoop Dogg/Snoop Lion and Rob enjoy some "Over the Tizzle Celebrizzles," watch the "Foreign 5-0" bumble their jobs and see what happens when kids have "Too Much Pep."

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: All over the world men and women fight for the protection of nature reserves and endangered species. This is their story, a story of bravery and stamina. We visit scientists in Central Europe who monitor the offspring of the rare lynx nearly 200 years after these elusive cats were extinct in the wild. We follow the work of the moose detective in Sweden on the island of Oland who tries to solve the riddle of increasing numbers of dead moose calves. In the heart of Africa one woman and her guards try to protect rare lowland gorillas and forest elephants but the increasing bush meat trade and the ongoing ivory smuggling makes their work extremely dangerous. Last but not least we meet US conservationists who rescue manatees in Florida - they have all dedicated their life to make a change. Without their work our world would be poorer.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: Wild Moments: Four Seasons - Spring & Summer
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. In Japan the first picnics at the cherry blossom festival kick off the long-awaited outdoor season, while the Scots perform their Highland Games. In the summer the Latvians celebrate the biggest party of the year: midsummer night. The vast wildflower meadows provide them with wreathes of flowers which have magical healing powers; animals are provided with an abundance of insects. This enables the rare hoopoe to breed in Latvia. In the Spree forest region, an enchanting river landscape south-east of Berlin, farmers still harvest the famous Spreeforest Cucumber. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a visual journey around the globe meeting people who are passionate and dedicated at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. Near the outermost border of Europe, in Bashkiria, generations of bee keepers have collected honey from rare wild bees, the Burzyan bees. In Japan the last of the Usho catch fish with "living fishing rods": trained cormorants. Traditionally, they provided the Emperor's family with fresh fish. In Poland carp are fished from the ponds to provide everybody with carp for Christmas dinner - this is an old Polish tradition. In Frisia winter is driven out by fires at what is known as "Biikebrennen", and in Hungary the "Busho" - frightening characters wearing wooden masks - do a similar job. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a journey, meeting people who are passionate at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers experience many emotionally touching moments on their expeditions while observing their main characters over a longer period of time. A lucky moment for Oliver Goetzl and Ivo Nörenberg in the Yellowstone National Park: When a wolf appears they give up on a lone newborn bison. But at the very last moment, its mother arrives and saves it. On an expedition in the Himalayas, Henry Mix is able to find Bengal tigers. A kangaroo mother even allows Thoralf Grospitz to film its tiny baby in her pouch. But they witness sad moments as well: On the Arctic Wrangel Island, Uwe Anders has to watch a snowy owl mother stop feeding one of her two chicks due to the shortage of food that year. "Big emotions" shows the most touching and the most heart-breaking moments wildlife filmmakers have experienced all over the world.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: Of Flying Foxes and Heat Waves
programme.desc: While the Tolga Bat Hospital is looking after endangered flying foxes, researchers are using thermographic cameras to search for flying foxes and koalas. But they can also detect bush and wildfire more quickly.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: Of Sea Turtles and Coral Reefs
programme.desc: The Cairns Turtle Rehabilitation Center (CTRC) raises and cares for sick, or injured turtles, while the Schmidt Ocean Institute goes on a diving mission with a high-tech underwater rover. In this way, we learn firsthand about the state of Australia's sensitive marine animals' natural habitat and what needs to be done to ensure their survival.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.desc: Tasmania's Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary used to be a traditional wildlife park - now it is an innovative and active wildlife sanctuary and home to the famous Tasmanian Devil, to wombats, and many other native species. But unfortunately, "Tassie Devils" are particularly endangered by the Devil Facial Tumor Disease (DFTD). We accompany the team of young, ambitious scientists on their fight against the disease.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.desc: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary was opened in 1927 at a time when Koalas were still being killed on a large scale for the fur trade. Today, hardly anything threatens the natural habitats of these animals as much as the desertification of the forests. We let the drones fly and are there when a new tree is planted.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.desc: Visiting the fenced nature reserve Arid Recovery in southern Australia, we witness the care of an injured kangaroo and follow researchers at the Hidden Vale Wildlife Centre near Brisbane as they train native animals to detect tracks of threatening predators and then move to safety.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: Of Fairy Penguins and GPS Trackers
programme.desc: Australia's largest fur seal colony is located on Phillip Island. Night after night, a breathtaking spectacle takes place here: At sunset, countless fairy penguins return from their hunt for fish. In the station near the penguin colony, pioneering scientific research is conducted around the cute animals. We learn how dedicated scientists are trying to secure the future of the fairy penguins with the help of GPS trackers.

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of Mahé to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the Mahé jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: mareTV: Hong Kong - Metropolis in the sea
programme.desc: Hong Kong translated means "fragrant harbour". The days of the spicy smoking ceremonies have passed, but MareTV has discovered many delightful contrasts between the metropolis and Mother Nature. In for-mer times, the rare eagle wood tree grew here. Its wood put the spice into the Taoist smoking ceremonies. The fragrant harbour: what sounds so charming is today a huge metropolis in the sea. No other tiny piece of land is more densely populated. Star Ferries have been commuting between the Kowloon Peninsula and central Hong Kong for the past 125 years. The British colonial masters are long gone, but on the ancient ferries, virtually nothing has changed. Most of the ships are still clad in British Racing Green and the crew still wears the old, decorative uniforms.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book – and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere – in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius – nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius – by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs – Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao Tomé and Príncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde – the islands of Saudade, of longing. For Stéphane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: mareTV: Martinique
programme.desc: The island of Martinique is a piece of France in the Caribbean, between Florida and South America. And of course, Savoir-vivre applies just as it does on the other side of the Atlantic, between the English Channel and the Mediterranean. Jacky Pascault is the first and only man to cultivate mushrooms in the Caribbean. Everywhere else, they grow on artificially fertilised soil, but Jacky's Champignons Tropicaux flourish on sugar cane fibres. Nicole Vilo tailors hats and dresses out of coconut palms. Of course, the catwalk for the models wearing her first collection is one of the countless dream beaches. The Martiniquais sail on boats they call Yole, which have no keel and are therefore difficult to navigate. The crew members hang over the water in breakneck fashion on long wooden poles. Just the job for Yole-boss Max' "problem kids": they not only learn complicated handling, but also team spirit.

programme.title: mareTV: Curacao, Blue Wonder of the Caribbean
programme.desc: Curacao is one of the most popular attractions for countless cruise ships on their trips through the Caribbean, because it is located outside of the hurricane belt. This is why Eric Miguel is constantly in action. He is the bridge keeper of the Queen Emma Bridge, the landmark of Curacao's capital, Willemstad. After his shift, Eric goes to Yvonne Troeman's cook-shop. Her speciality is Kadushi, a cactus soup. The ingredients include cactus flesh, pigtail's, mussels and a few secret "treats". Barbara van Bebber is the only submarine pilot on Curacao and literally gets to the bottom of things amidst the turquoise-blue wonder of the Caribbean. She charters out her sub to marine biologists and wealthy private explorers, simultaneously cleaning up on the seabed. Her "Curasub" has claw arms, which she employs to remove anything that doesn't belong down there: beer bottles, car tyres, and plastic refuse. Jeroen Eikelenboom simply carts sand from a neighbouring cove to his own surf club in his favourite bay.

programme.title: mareTV: Mexico's Caribbean Coast
programme.desc: The palm tree laden beaches on Mexico's Riviera Maya on the Yucatan peninsula are endless, and the turquoise sea with its gentle Caribbean surf is a warm 25 degrees during the mild winter in this part of the world. Between Cancún and Punta Allen, where once there was little more than bushland and a few sleepy fishing villages, vibrant life has evolved during the past three decades. Richard Sowa has lived on a floating island for the past 15 years: an island he built himself out of empty plastic bottles. The bon vivant him-self sees it as a "solution for our planet's refuse problem". Off Punta Allen, a village in the bay of Sian Ka'an, Mexican Mara Coral Ley and her cousin Kim, continue to catch lobsters by adhering to the traditional method and were awarded an "Eco seal for sustainable fishing" for their trouble. It is silent under water off Isla Mujeres and it is here that the artist Jason deCaires has constructed a sculpture park. Hundreds of lifesize figures form an artificial reef at a depth of 12 metres. Fish and plants complete his work of art. The master himself is convinced: "Mother Nature is the true artist".

programme.title: Caribbean sisters: The Lesser Antilles St. Kitts & Nevis
programme.desc: In the centre of the Caribbean, volcanoes rise steeply from the sea, thus shaping the sister islands of St. Kitts & Nevis. Their slopes, covered in lush rainforests, snow-white, sandy beaches and the surrounding tur-quoise tinted waters provide the ultimate setting for this record-breaking, albeit tiny island paradise: Both islets are the smallest of the Caribbean dwarf states and also rank among the world’s ten smallest states. A hot pepper sauce, made of a creative mixture of ginger, garlic, thyme and extraordinarily hot chillies that thrive in the hot and humid climate of Nevis, is simmering on the stove of Violet and Llewellyn’s house. Lemmy Pemberton digs up abandoned turtle nests with his bare hands, as he wants to be certain that all of the babies have indeed managed to make it. Members of the Turtle Group catch sea turtles in order to take their measurements and fit them with transmitters. Taxi bus-es are not only the main means of transport on St. Kitts & Nevis, they are also an artistic expression of each driver’s personality. Colourfully embellished, each taxi represents island art on wheels.

programme.title: Cuba - Brilliantly Caribbean
programme.desc: Even anyone who has not yet been to Cuba can conjure up certain images of American vintage street cruisers, imposing buildings that have seen better days, white sandy beaches full of palms and loving couples on the Malecón against a backdrop of crashing waves. This island is somewhat of a myth and its people generate a special joie de vivre. The legendary Hershey Train departs for Matanzas from the capital, Havana. On the oldest electrified railway line in the Caribbean, 60-year-old Spanish carriages make their way along al-most 100 kilometres of coastline in the most relaxed way possible. The Salvavidas on Varadero, probably the most famous beach on the island, have a particular-ly beautiful workplace. The lifeguards' territory ex-tends for more than 20 kilometres. In order to protect the coasts of Cuba, mangroves have been replanted here for many years. The project is supported by the UN and planting is often carried out by schoolchildren. In doing so, Cuban children learn how to treat their maritime habitat in a sustainable fashion. The former colonial city of Trinidad on Cuba's south coast is gen-erally considered to be one of the most beautiful places in the entire Caribbean. The houses here are particular-ly colourful. A plethora of magnificent buildings can be seen at the Plaza Mayor, the neo-baroque main square.

programme.title: mareTV: The Caribbean for explorers: St. Vincent and the Grenadines
programme.desc: Much more Caribbean than on the islands of St. Vincent and the Grenadines is hardly possible. Deserted beaches, uninhabited islands, lush vegetation, the 33 islands in total are dreamlike with extremely hospitable inhabitants. Miranda Phillips runs a laundry and water boat on Bequia. Every morning, the 32-year-old navigates from yacht to yacht with her small bright green service vehicle and is already expected by most skippers. Miranda promises radiantly fresh laundry, which she delivers again the same day. And so there is always something going on in her tiny laundrette in the harbour. It turns into a karaoke bar in the evening, because that is Miranda's great passion. Eban Olliver has many jobs at once. He is the lighthouse keeper of Kingstown. And that means a lot of responsibility in St. Vincent's biggest port city. Because Eban doesn't just change the light bulbs, he's a pilot dispatcher, harbour master and guard all in one person. First contact with ships is particularly important. Once he even saved the entire nation from an Ebola virus.

programme.title: The Heart of Hawaii - The Island of Oahu
programme.desc: The Oahu island is the economic and cultural centre of the Hawaiian archipelago, as well as being a paradise for surfers, active holidaymakers and freedom lovers. The island is home to more than half of all natives and almost eight million foreign guests annually. Anyone searching for peace and seclusion won’t find either in Honolulu or Waikiki. Traffic congestion and a backdrop of skyscrapers belong to the town panorama. Hip cafes, galleries and young fashion firms have settled here, adding a new and modern flair to the capital. Cindy’s Lei Shoppe, the Chinatown florists, has been here for more than 30 years. This is also because the so-called Leis, the tradition of floral decoration, usually offered as a flower necklace or as a headdress, is still an important part of Hawaiian culture. Keone Nunes is well-known for his traditional tattooing skills, whereby the so-called Kakau Tattoos are virtually hammered into the skin with a hippo tooth. But Oahu is also an island of overwhelming natural beauty and a fascinating diversity on the smallest of places ...

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of Mahé to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the Mahé jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.
